set.commands:
PACKAGE_NAME=curl PACKAGE_VERSION=7.34.0
oegimport libidn # needs gettext (libintl) oegimport gettext # needs libiconv oegimport libiconv oegimport zlib oegimport gnutls oegimport gmp # required oegimport readline oegimport nettle # required #oegimport zlib # optional, for compression oegimport libtasn1 # optional, for ASN.1 parsing, a copy is included in GnuTLS oegimport p11-kit # optional, for smart card support #oegimport libiconv #oegimport gettext #oegimport libtasn1 oegimport libffi oegimport openssl #oegimport zlib
oegextract ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}.tar.bz2
# no includes in CFLAGS! #export CFLAGS="-m32 -march=i686 -mtune=i686 -pipe -O2 -mms-bitfields -fomit-frame-pointer" #export CPPFLAGS="$CFLAGS -I/open-egovernment/include"
# disabled most options # no: librtmp libmetalink libssh2
# The configure option --enable-threaded-resolver has two # threading models: USE_THREADS_POSIX and USE_THREADS_WIN32. # But it always defines -lpthreads and USE_THREADS_POSIX. # However the error occurs since removing --without-ssl --without-gnutls # and adding the corresponding --with-... options. You can look at # the currently selected resolver threading library in the configure summary page # Maybe this helps?: oegimport pthreads-win32-2.9.1 # Bug http://curl.haxx.se/mail/lib-2012-01/0291.html suggests # removing --enable-threaded-resolver and adding CPPFLAGS='-DUSE_THREADS_WIN32=1'.
